verses.roman:
nityānande kahilā--"tumi nā āsiha bāra-bāra
tathāi āmāra saṅga ha-ibe tomāra"

synonyms: nityānande—unto Nityānanda Prabhu; kahilā—said; tumi—You; nā āsiha—do not come; bāra-bāra—again and again; tathāi—there (in Bengal); āmāra—My; saṅga—association; ha-ibe—there will be; tomāra—Your.
translation: The Lord specifically advised Nityānanda Prabhu, "You should not come here again and again. You will have My association in Bengal."
